problem_text:
The non-p-soluble length of a finite group G is the number of non-p-soluble factors in a shortest normal series each of whose factors either is p-soluble or is a direct product of non-abelian simple groups of order divisible by p. For a given prime p and a given proper group variety V, is there a bound for the non-p-soluble length of finite groups whose Sylow p-subgroups belong to V?
Comment of 2021: the existence of such a bound is proved for p = 2 (F. Fumagalli, F. Leinen, O. Puglisi, Proc. London Math. Soc. (3), 125, no. 5 (2022), 1066–1082).
E. I. Khukhro, P. Shumyatsky
